name: Scholars of Finance
shortDescription: The Columbia Chapter of Scholars of Finance aims to advance the Scholars of Finance mission of instilling character and integrity in its members.

name: Biomedical Engineering Society
shortDescription: We aim to provide undergraduates with a supportive and enriching academic experience in BME!

name: Columbia Right to Life
shortDescription: Columbia Right to Life is a secular student advocacy club that creates constructive dialogue around human life issues on campus and in our community.

name: Student Health Outreach (CI)
shortDescription: SHOUT is a volunteer organization that serves to enroll low-income populations surrounding our community in much-needed assistance programs.

name: Columbia Neuroscience Society
shortDescription: We aim to provide a community for those interested in neuroscience, mentorship, and community service.

name: The Varsity Show
shortDescription: Columbia’s Oldest Performing Arts Tradition

name: Project Tutors (CI)
shortDescription: Students volunteer at an elementary school once per week to work with and tutor students, and also assist teachers (part of Community Impact)

name: Columbia SHARP
shortDescription: Columbia University's smoothest all-male a cappella group. Focused on R&B, pop, and more!

name: Columbia Research and Diversity
shortDescription: CUR&D is an organization dedicated to supporting and creating community for Black, Latinx, Native, and FGLI students in STEM research.

name: Students for Sanctuary
shortDescription: Students for Sanctuary is an initiative that takes direct action in the fight for immigration justice and reform.

name: Columbia China Dance
shortDescription: Columbia China Dance spreads Chinese culture through traditional and contemporary Chinese dance performances on and off-campus.

name: CU Sign
shortDescription: CU Sign is Columbia's American Sign Language (ASL) club. We offer free ASL classes every week.

name: Columbia EcoReps
shortDescription: Largest student-run sustainability club on campus

name: Columbia University UNICEF Club
shortDescription: The Columbia University chapter of UNICEF USA.

name: Columbia University Ballet Ensemble
shortDescription: As Columbia's largest ballet cast, CUBE provides dancers with the unique opportunity to dance dream roles in full-length classical story ballets.

name: Columbia Daily Spectator
shortDescription: Spec is Columbia's largest student-run media group, comprised of our journalism sections and our business and innovations team.

name: Columbia Classical Performers
shortDescription: We are the premier independent classical music performance group on campus! Come by to show off your music, hear others', and make new friends!

name: Women's and Gender Diverse Ultimate Frisbee
shortDescription: Columbia Women’s Ultimate is a D-1 club sport that welcomes students with all levels of Ultimate experience.

name: Columbia Financial Investment Group (CFIG)
shortDescription: We are Columbia’s largest undergraduate finance club. We aim to create future leaders and equip members with an understanding of the markets.

name: Useless Art Society
shortDescription: The Useless Art Society is a student artist collective focused on accessibility and experimentation in visual art practice.

name: Columbia Ballet Collaborative
shortDescription: CBC brings together professional-level dancers with NYC based choreographers in semesterly shows, composed of original choreographic work.

name: Columbia University Bhangra
shortDescription: Columbia University Bhangra is a competitive collegiate dance team that combines traditional and contemporary styles of Bhangra.

name: Consilience: The Journal of Sustainable Development
shortDescription: A semesterly publication focused on sharing interdisciplinary research in and articles on sustainable development.

name: Columbia Wushu
shortDescription: The largest collegiate Chinese martial arts club in the NYC area. We welcome newcomers and experienced practitioners alike!

name: WKCR FM
shortDescription: Columbia's student-led, educational, and noncommercial radio station, broadcasting an eclectic mix of music and journalism.

name: Columbia Women's Business Society (CWBS)
shortDescription: CWBS is the largest preprofessional organization on campus, dedicated to inspiring and promoting women in business.

name: Reformed University Fellowship (RUF)
shortDescription: Regardless of your beliefs or background, we are a diverse community where you can explore Christianity and the hope found in knowing Jesus Christ.

name: Project Access Columbia
shortDescription: Columbia students helping disadvantaged high school students around the world apply to top US, UK, and EU universities for free.

name: Pi Sigma Alpha Honor Society
shortDescription: Pi Sigma Alpha honor society welcomes Political Science majors, concentrators, and minors of high quality committed to intellectual exploration.

name: Columbia University Science Fiction Society (CUSFS)
shortDescription: Sci-fi (+ fantasy!) club: a home for all nerds, geeks, and aficionados to chat about books, tv, movies, + cool science. Games, movies, fun, friends!

name: New Aesthetes of Columbia University
shortDescription: We aim to bring together people who like all forms of beauty. We read, hike, write, bike, make music, ski, etc. Host of The Orations!

name: Columbia Organization of Rising Entrepreneurs (CORE)
shortDescription: Columbia's premier entrepreneurship organization with initiatives including the Almaworks Startup Accelerator, Founderschool, and more!

name: Columbia European Society
shortDescription: CES is the only university-wide society at Columbia bringing together all students interested in Europe and European affairs.

name: Columbia University Family Support Network (CUFSN)
shortDescription: A university-wide organization focused on members of the Columbia community with families through peer connection and advocacy.

name: Columbia Sewa
shortDescription: An organization based upon the universal values of peace, equality, social justice, and the Sikh principle of sewa (selfless service).

name: The Remedy Project
shortDescription: The Remedy Project (formerly known as the Student Justice League) trains students to advocate on behalf of incarcerated people.

name: CoLab Performing Arts Collective
shortDescription: interdisciplinary performing arts group

name: Lion Fund LLC
shortDescription: Lion Fund Capital Management, LLC is Columbia University's premier undergraduate student-run investment fund managing $50,000+ in assets.

name: Columbia University Rock Climbing
shortDescription: We are an indoor and outdoor climbing club climbing at the local gym and organizing trips around the New York area!

name: CU Lion Dance
shortDescription: CULD is the official collegiate Lion Dance team at Columbia University. Our lions are proud to have served the NYC community for over a decade.

name: Matriculate
shortDescription: Advise students who need your support applying to college

name: Uptown Vocal
shortDescription: Columbia's Premier Jazz A Cappella Group

name: Columbia Youth for Debate
shortDescription: YFD is a selected team of debate coaches supporting youth in developing argumentative speaking skills, culminating in an on-campus tournament.

name: Columbia Synapse
shortDescription: We're a neuroscience based club focused on building community and awareness around ABI/TBI and other invisible disabilities in NYC and beyond.

name: Alianza
shortDescription: Columbia's pan-Latinx student organization

name: Columbia University Dance Team
shortDescription: The Columbia University Dance Team performs various types of dance including pom, jazz, and hip-hop at Football and Men and Women's Basketball.

name: CU Pre-Vet Society
shortDescription: All animal lovers welcome!

name: Active Minds at CU
shortDescription: Active Minds at CU is a chapter of Active Minds Inc., a national nonprofit organization that empowers students to speak openly about mental health.

name: Mock Trial
shortDescription: Mock Trial is a competitive activity in which teams simulate real trials, both as attorneys and witnesses.

name: Gosh Yarn It!
shortDescription: Gosh Yarn It is Columbia University's premier crochet and knitting club! We provide the yarn, needles, and hooks, you bring the hands!

name: Columbia Iranian Students Association
shortDescription: CISA brings people together to engage with Iranian/Persian culture and community through art, music, dance, food, workshops, and social events.

name: Columbia Political Union
shortDescription: The CPU is Columbia's multipartisan umbrella political organization. We are a home for political dialogue, civic engagement, and healthy discourse.

name: Columbia Global Research and Consulting (GRC)
shortDescription: Columbia GRC is the largest undergraduate management consulting club on Columbia campus. We provide strategic advisory to social impact clients.

name: CU Generation
shortDescription: Columbia University (CU) Generation is an urban collegiate dance team/family founded in 2010.

name: Latenite Theatre
shortDescription: Latenite happens.

name: Roosevelt @ Columbia
shortDescription: Roosevelt @ Columbia is a progressive, nonpartisan, student-run think tank associated with the broader Roosevelt National Network.

name: Columbia UnTapped
shortDescription: UnTapped is Columbia's tap-dancing club and the self-proclaimed “most fun group on campus.” Tappers of all levels practice, learn, and perform!

name: Artist's Reaching Out (CI)
shortDescription: ARO is a volunteering program that brings arts education to kids who have limited opportunities for enrichment in the arts.

name: Columbia Pops
shortDescription: Entirely student-run, Pops' goal is to engage a diverse group of talented students as performance artists, conductors, arrangers, and much more!

name: Coalition Against Sexual Violence (CASV)
shortDescription: We develop programming serving the needs of sexual violence survivors and their support networks. We also establish club partnerships & host events.

name: SOON Movement
shortDescription: SOON Movement (formerly known as KCCC) is a Christian fellowship committed to sharing the Gospel by doing life and faith with students on our campus.

name: Peace by PEACE (CI)
shortDescription: Peace by PEACE is a community service club and is a conflict resolution skill development program for elementary school students.

name: NOMADS (New and Original Material Authored and Directed by Students)
shortDescription: NOMADS is a theater group dedicated to workshopping and producing original plays and musicals written by current Barnard and Columbia students.

name: Taiwanese American Students Association (TASA)
shortDescription: We are a community that aims to celebrate and spread the presence of Taiwanese culture on campus. People of all cultural backgrounds are welcome!

name: Columbia University Amnesty International(CUAI)
shortDescription: CUAI seeks to keep our community informed about human rights violations around the world and to promote student actions to end and prevent them

name: Columbia Kingsmen
shortDescription: Columbia University's Finest All-Male A Cappella Group

name: Engineers Without Borders (EWB)
shortDescription: EWB supports international community-driven development by collaborating with local partners to design and implement sustainable engineering projects.

name: Big Sibs Columbia (CI)
shortDescription: Big Sibs is dedicated to building relationships with the local youth through one-on-one mentorship. Get to know the city AND make a new friend!

name: Food Recovery Network (FRN)
shortDescription: We deliver leftover food from dining halls and local food businesses to community partners such as food shelters and pantries.

name: Columbia Bartending Agency
shortDescription: The Columbia Bartending Agency is a student-run organization providing bartenders to service NYC's top parties and private events since 1965.

name: Columbia Model United Nations Conference and Exposition (CMUNCE)
shortDescription: CMUNCE is the premier high school Model UN conference in the US, hosted annually by Columbia undergraduates! No prior experience needed to join!

name: CU Games Club
shortDescription: We play games on Thursdays! Mostly card games, but board games as well.

name: Columbia Marketing Club
shortDescription: Columbia Marketing Club is the premier group that serves members of the Columbia’s undergraduate community who are interested in marketing and brand.

name: Chinese Students Club
shortDescription: We aim to promote awareness of Chinese culture at Columbia. Our events and activities are Chinese in theme, but are open to everyone!

name: HeForShe Columbia
shortDescription: HeForShe is a solidarity campaign for gender equality initiated by UN Women

name: Columbia/Barnard Hillel
shortDescription: Creating welcoming Jewish communities on campus and beyond. Visit at the Kraft Center on 115th, and follow us on instagram @cbhillel.

name: Columbia University's Impact Investing Network (CUIIN)
shortDescription: Columbia University’s Impact Investing Network is a student group on campus committed to informing the Columbia community about impact investing.

name: J Street U
shortDescription: J Street U is Pro Israel, Pro Palestine, Pro Peace, Pro Democracy, Pro Justice, Pro Human Rights.

name: Asian American Alliance
shortDescription: pan-Asian political group: strives to promote understanding, develop consciousness, foster dialogue, and champion solidarity within the AAPI community

name: Student Government Association (SGA)
shortDescription: SGA works to better the Barnard community by advocating for students and facilitating communication between students, administration, and faculty!

name: BlueShift
shortDescription: Columbia's Undergraduate Astronomy Club

name: Quarto
shortDescription: Quarto is the official undergrad literary magazine of CU’s Creative Writing Dept. It is student-run and publishes the best of CU’s undergrad writers.

name: Christian Union Lumine
shortDescription: Christian Union Lumine is a space for the students of Columbia University to build real connections, encounter God, and discover truth.

name: Columbia Undergraduate Law Review
shortDescription: The Columbia Undergraduate Law Review (CULR) is Columbia University's premier undergraduate legal publication.

name: 116th & Partners, LLC
shortDescription: 116th & Partners is a student-run investment fund managing over $20,000 with a focus on growth and value investments across public equities.

name: Alpha Kappa Psi
shortDescription: AKPsi is Columbia's only co-ed business fraternity. We are open to all schools/majors and help our brothers grow personally and professionally at CU.

name: Columbia-Barnard YDSA (Young Democratic Socialists of America)
shortDescription: We're the largest left-wing political organization on campus, dedicated to fighting for student and worker power on campus and beyond.

name: Columbia Space Initiative (CSI)
shortDescription: The Columbia Space Initiative is a group of students and professors dedicated to the pursuit of knowledge in near-space, space, and beyond.

name: Columbia Debate Society
shortDescription: The Columbia Debate Society is an institution dedicated to helping individuals express themselves, improve discourse, and enact positive change.

name: One-to-One Tutoring (CI)
shortDescription: Providing free academic support to elementary and middle school students live or attend school in Morningside Heights, Washington Heights, and Harlem.

name: United Nations Columbia
shortDescription: We are the official Columbia University-Wide Campus Chapter of the United Nations Association of the United States of America (UNA-USA CUWC).

name: Columbia Taal
shortDescription: Columbia University's South Asian Classical Fusion Dance Team

name: The Columbia Witness
shortDescription: A publication proclaiming the life and power of God’s truth to the Columbia community through diverse Christian voices and ideas.

name: Columbia Queer Alliance
shortDescription: Columbia Queer Alliance (CQA) is the oldest queer collegiate student organization in the nation.

name: Sabor: Columbia's First Latin Dance Troupe
shortDescription: Sabor is Columbia University's first Latino dance troupe. Established in 2003, Sabor performs all your favorite Latin dances and more.

name: Columbia Science Review
shortDescription: The Columbia Science Review (CSR) is an undergraduate student organization dedicated to promoting scientific engagement and inquiry.

name: Collegium Musicum
shortDescription: Vocal ensemble specializing in music of the Middle Ages and Renaissance.

name: Columbia Students for Justice in Palestine
shortDescription: Organized on democratic principles to promote justice, human rights, liberation, and self-determination for the Palestinian people.

name: Korean Students Association
shortDescription: Our primary mission is to promote cultural and social events both on and off-campus to celebrate Korea's rich culture and heritage. Established 1989.

name: Barnard Zine Club
shortDescription: BZC is a club for creating and appreciating zines!

name: Asian Youth Program (AYP) (CI)
shortDescription: Asian Youth Program (AYP), in partnership with Womankind and Community Impact, offers mentoring to children (ages 6-12) impacted by domestic violence.

name: American Society of Civil Engineers
shortDescription: The American Society of Civil Engineers aims to build a community for individuals interested in Civil Engineering and the built environment.

name: Community Lunch - Soup Kitchen (CI)
shortDescription: Community Lunch volunteers work as a team to prepare a four-course meal from scratch for 100+ homeless and low-income guests every Friday!

name: Neurotech X Columbia
shortDescription: Columbia's undergraduate neuroengineering club

name: Athena Digital Design Agency
shortDescription: The Athena Digital Design Agency offers free web development courses and entrepreneurship opportunities to the Barnard community.

name: Housing Equity Project
shortDescription: Housing Equity Project is dedicated to serving folks experiencing homelessness and mitigating the harmful impacts of Columbia's gentrification.
